MR2 Tenth Anniversary Challenge Q&A
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Coliseum (Public Monster Rancher Tournaments): The Locker Room (Q&A): MR2 Tenth Anniversary Challenge Q&A
By Lisa Shock on Sunday, April 19, 2009 - 08:08 pm:

Post any questions about the upcoming event here!

By Subster on Monday, April 20, 2009 - 10:37 am:

Mailing you the mem card, you said you would mail it back. Now roughly how much shipping cost would it be to mail to you and back from Toronto, Canada?

As well, I've raised a Metalner, but why no Metalners?

By Lisa Shock on Monday, April 20, 2009 - 07:51 pm:

The guts regen rate is higher than any other monster, meaning that it's pretty much an instant win for anyone entering. By eliminating Metalners, we open the field to more types with similar guts regen to each other.

Looks like a small padded envelope at a total of 8 ounces would cost $2.66 US to send to Canada. I just guestimated the weight, it's probably an ounce or two less depending on the envelope used. But $6 should cover it.

By TracedInAir on Friday, September 4, 2009 - 02:56 pm:

Why is Metazorl not allowed? Just wondering.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, September 4, 2009 - 04:28 pm:

Because the regen rate wasn't known at the time of the event announcement. It's not fair to go back and change the rules.

By TracedInAir on Friday, September 4, 2009 - 05:30 pm:

Yeah, I guess so.

Not to be a bother but I have another question. My girlfriend and I share a saved file, but I assure you we are two different people (we each have our own account on this site also). Are we still limited to 3 monsters between us? It's unlikely to pose a huge concern but I'd still like to know in case.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, September 4, 2009 - 10:42 pm:

No, you can each enter 3.

By TracedInAir on Monday, September 14, 2009 - 01:05 pm:

I'm somewhat aware of the process for asking for a Slot - I'm curious though as to how far in advance we have to ask for it? Is there a cap, ie if I register a day or two before will I lose out? Basically is there any risk at all to registering last minute?

Thanks again, sorry for my seemingly endless amount of questions.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, September 15, 2009 - 08:41 am:

Not too much risk right now.

By TracedInAir on Tuesday, September 15, 2009 - 04:09 pm:

Thanks.

By Zilk the Rank S Master on Tuesday, November 17, 2009 - 03:15 pm:

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, November 17, 2009 - 07:35 pm:

By Zilk the Rank S Master on Wednesday, November 18, 2009 - 04:02 am:

By Zilk the Rank S Master on Wednesday, November 18, 2009 - 01:20 pm:

By Zilk the Rank S Master on Saturday, November 21, 2009 - 06:44 pm:

By John Hawley on Sunday, November 22, 2009 - 02:30 am:

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, November 22, 2009 - 05:47 pm:

Send it to:
monster.rancher.metropolis (at) gmail.com

By Subster on Friday, December 4, 2009 - 05:33 pm:

Ok forgive me for this question but where could I find the official rules for this tournament? I see in my older post I know of the no Metalner rule meaning I found it before but now I can't find it now :/

On a positive note I'll be mailing you two memory cards because my friend will be joining. Also should I slip in some money into the envelope for you to mail it back? Or is there an easier method?

By Lisa Shock on Friday, December 4, 2009 - 10:03 pm:

The guidelines are here:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Coliseum (Public Monster Rancher Tournaments): Mayors Cup: Tournament Announcements: MR2 Tenth Anniversary Challenge September 4, 2009

(I have to change the date...) Other than owning a dex drive, and have a PC with a serial port to support it, mailing the card is the best way to go. It's only a couple dollars, and I do return them.

By TracedInAir on Thursday, January 7, 2010 - 10:10 am:

Is there any way of knowing if the monsters I sent in were received and that my dexdrive didn't mess up? Should I e-mail you?

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, January 7, 2010 - 11:17 am:

Were you the one who emailed a long time ago?

I got the email, haven't tried to hook up the dex and test them. My current computer doesn't have a serial port so I want to try a USB to serial connector I got -guess I've just been afraid it won't work.

But, I do have an older computer on my home network, and, I can use tht one if need be.

By TracedInAir on Wednesday, January 20, 2010 - 07:05 pm:

Yeah I e-mailed a long time ago. I kept forgetting about the tournament but it was never a big deal since it hasn't started yet.

Also, I figured I should say this - my university's computers have serial ports (aka the old 9-pin ones) at the back, meaning I could even get my dexdrive to work there worst-case-scenario (I'm probably going to try just to see if it works honestly). So if you can't get a USB-to-serial connector working, and if you go to school still, maybe that's a decent alternative.
